channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Water Leak, 17th August
item.description:
There seems to be what looks like a water leak. Earlier in the week there were electric works done by power networks. Not sure if that has caused it.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 47, Friern Barnet Lane, Friern Barnet, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:
Dog owners in the area not clearing up after their dogs while walking.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Oakdene Road, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Piano left on the pavement, 17th August
item.description:
Piano abandoned on the pavement next to 68 Gurdon Road. Drunk people come and play the piano in the middle of the night and wake up the surrounding houses. Also takes up crucial pavement space for wheelchairs and buggies as it becomes a tight squeeze or you need to walk on the road. Been left there for several weeks, trying to improve the cleanliness of our streets and not encourage fly tipping.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Gurdon Road, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dear mayor of Hackney can you please address this issue of illegal drug misuse in public park in broad daylight in front of children and families black Caribbean males smoking drugs selling drugs doing barbecues loud sound system set up in park all day going on. This is antisocial behaviour what is the local commissioner at the metropolitan police doing about this and the mayor of Hackney., 17th August
item.description:
Drug dealing and drug misuse in public park in front of family and children in school term holidays. How to cancel deal with this anti-social behavior this is disgraceful in a public park.
Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Queensdown Road, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dumped bulk waste, 17th August
item.description:
There is a large build up of bulk waste at the corner of Fleming Road, near number 24. There are white goods bed, mattress, furniture and other things. Its very unsightly and also a fire risk. Seems to be getting worse by the day.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Forsyth Gardens, Elephant and Castle, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Outside 34 Boundary Road, 17th August
item.description:
The vehicle has been abandoned outside 34 Boundary Road for 8 weeks. It has no MOT and has been broken into and is at risk of further criminal damage and is bringing the status of the road down by its state. RE16YOG-black Volkswagen Caddy
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 41, Boundary Road, Falconwood, London

item.title: Please cut back the hedge along road its now a health hazard, 17th August

item.category: Obstruction - Overgrown / overhanging private tree / hedge

item.title: Phelp Street , regular occurrence of fly tipping, 17th August
item.description:
I reported this on the 16/08/25 of regular occurrence of fly tipping. If you look closely you can see box’s with address and names . When I checked today it stated the problem had been fixed. However this is not the case at 18:15 on 17/08/25 I can clearly see that the fly tipping has not been cleared. Why does Southwark Fix my street continue to state certain reports have been fixed , when they have not ?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Phelp Street, Walworth, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: BBQ waste and tent and chairs, 17th August
